summary: This tag encompasses resources that delve into the concept of ecosystems, both in biological and human organizational contexts. It includes an article highlighting the shift toward non-hierarchical and dispersed forms of social and business organizations and the role of ecosystem architecture in designing these networks. Additionally, it features profiles of industry leaders like Jan Hein Hoogstad, known for his expertise in design and technology.
excerpt: The term ecosystem has transcended its biological roots to describe new forms of human organization that are less hierarchical and more dispersed, necessitating a new practice called ecosystem architecture.
